main.name: Will McComis
main.description: I will soon begin my professional career at
main.jobDescription1: where I will be leading the devevelopment of
main.jobDescription2: next generation software products for the aviation industry
main.bio: Hi! My name is Will McComis. I am a recent graduate from the University of Notre Dame. I earned a BS in Computer Science and found that my passion for software development grew during my time at Notre Dame. With my skills, I decided to build a website to showcase my projects and my interests. I earned my private pilot’s certificate in 2020, added an instrument rating in 2021, and recently earned my commercial pilot license in March 2023. It’s safe to say aviation has been a large factor in my life the last three years. Combining my passions for aviation and software, I will be joining the Hiller Group in Tampa leading their technology development at NDX. NDX’s mission is to develop innovative software and hardware solutions that optimize operations at airports and FBOs across the nation. In my website, you will see some of my favorite projects while in college as well as some fun stats about my trips flying the last three years. Check out my flying section! I have been working really hard on it.
main.contactmessage: Interested in learning more about me or sharing your project with me?

work.title: Manager of Technology
work.line1: Leading technology development and innovation at NDX and across the Hiller organization in general.
work.line2: Our team focuses on delivering the industry's premier technological products that focus on airport and FBO operations, management, and safety. Using modern development methods and decades of experience in the industry, we strive to develop products that exceed expectations and deliver unmatched experiences.

work.line2: Collaborated with multiple Play Store teams to modify front-end and RPC layers to deliver a user facing feature that scales to billions of users

work.title: Software Engineer
work.line1: Developed aircraft tracking algorithm capable of monitoring the location of dozens of aircraft and ground support equipment to reduce ground collisions
work.line2: Kotlin/Java based algorithm led to an increase in positional accuracy with a reduction in database calls

work.title: Avionics Systems Engineering Intern
